title: QuackTrack Robot
description: Designed and prototyped a robotic duck toy to detect and follow a person useing websockets to send an image to a server for processing with real-time motor control via a PID loop with an IMU, to achive smooth and responsive motion.
details: This project was for EE327: Electronic System Design II. The project involved designing the electrical system and sourcing components, programming the microcontroller (ESP32-CAM) in C++ to take a picture, send it to a server over a websocket, and reciecve a command from the server to follow a target. The server processes the image using OpenCV to identify the target and sends back directional commands. The microcontroller then translates these commands into an angualar velocity, which is maintained by a PID loop using data from an onboard IMU. The robot was able to successfully follow a person, demonstrating effective integration of hardware and software components.
